Docs.summary: Base class for all persistence related commands. Commands are distinguished by their Name. Usually commands can also be distinguished by their derived type.

Docs.summary: Indicates whether the command could attempt to acquire a lock on the instance.
Docs.value: if the command acquires a lock on the instance;, otherwise . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The command classes that derive from this class can override this property to set it to `true`.

Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the persistence provider may choose not to enlist in the ambient transaction (Transaction.Currnet) when executing this command.
Docs.value: if enlisting in the transaction is optional for this command, otherwise .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The command classes that derive from this class can override this property to set it to `true`.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the persistence command.
Docs.value: An XName (the combination of namespace and name).

MemberSignature.Value: protected internal virtual void Validate (System.Runtime.DurableInstancing.InstanceView view);
.method familyorassemblyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void Validate(class System.Runtime.DurableInstancing.InstanceView view) cil managed
Protected Friend Overridable Sub Validate (view As InstanceView)
protected public: virtual void Validate(System::Runtime::DurableInstancing::InstanceView ^ view);
abstract member Validate : System.Runtime.DurableInstancing.InstanceView -> unit override this.Validate : System.Runtime.DurableInstancing.InstanceView -> unit

Docs.param: An object representing the current state of the instance handle.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Commands override Validate to ensure that a command is valid to execute at the current time. Implementations should throw an InvalidOperationException if the command is not valid to execute against the InstanceView passed as a parameter. The Validate method is called by InstanceStore before the command is passed to InstanceStore.TryCommand.
